title: 26k-Kilometer 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S Coupe
description: This 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S is a left-hand drive Japanese-market coupe that shows shows 26k kilometers (~16k miles) and was imported into the United States in 2023. It is finished in Blue Turquoise over Midnight Blue leather and is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a four-speed Tiptronic transaxle. Equipment includes 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, cross-drilled brake rotors, lowered suspension package, power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, air conditioning, and a Porsche Classic Communication Management head unit. This 993 C2S is now offered in New York by the selling dealer with the owner's manual, service records, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a Michigan title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 26k-Kilometer 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S Coupe at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #196,554.
text: This 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S is a left-hand drive Japanese-market coupe that shows shows 26k kilometers (~16k miles) and was imported into the United States in 2023. It is finished in Blue Turquoise over Midnight Blue leather and is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a four-speed Tiptronic transaxle. Equipment includes 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, cross-drilled brake rotors, lowered suspension package, power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, air conditioning, and a Porsche Classic Communication Management head unit. This 993 C2S is now offered in New York by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, service records, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a Michigan title. The 993 C2S featured wider bodywork, a split rear grille, and revised bumper covers and side skirts in comparison with the contemporary Carrera. This example is finished in Blue Turquoise (L3AS) and features headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. Photos showing paint-meter readings are included in the gallery. The 18″ Turbo Twist wheels feature body-color centers and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport N3 tires, which show date codes from 2017. Braking is handled by Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners, and the car is equipped with the 033 lowered suspension package. The power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in Midnight Blue leather and complemented by a color-coordinated center console, door panels, and carpeting. Amenities include cruise control, air conditioning, and a Porsche Classic Communication Management head unit. The leather-wrapped steering wheel features Tiptronic S shift buttons and frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 300-km/h speedometer, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 26k kilometers (~16k miles). The air-cooled 3.6L M64 flat-six features a VarioRam intake system and was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 250 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed automatic transaxle with Tiptronic S manual shift mode. Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information: L3AS — Blue Turquoise paint FJ — Midnight Blue partial leather upholstery C08 — Version for Japan 033 — Lowered suspension 249 — Four-speed Tiptronic transaxle 425 — Rear window wiper 445 — Wheel caps with full-color Porsche crests 567 — Top-tinted windscreen 573 — Air conditioner 659 — Onboard computer The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage from an initial update in July 2023. The Michigan title carries a “not eligible for plates” notation. Filed under: 993 You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S is a left-hand drive Japanese-market coupe that shows shows 26k kilometers (~16k miles) and was imported into the United States in 2023. It is finished in Blue Turquoise over Midnight Blue leather and is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a four-speed Tiptronic transaxle. Equipment includes 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, cross-drilled brake rotors, lowered suspension package, power-adjustable front seats, cruise control, air conditioning, and a Porsche Classic Communication Management head unit. This 993 C2S is now offered in New York by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, service records, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a Michigan title.

The 993 C2S featured wider bodywork, a split rear grille, and revised bumper covers and side skirts in comparison with the contemporary Carrera. This example is finished in Blue Turquoise (L3AS) and features headlight washers, fog lights, power-adjustable mirrors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. Photos showing paint-meter readings are included in the gallery.

The 18″ Turbo Twist wheels feature body-color centers and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport N3 tires, which show date codes from 2017. Braking is handled by Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners, and the car is equipped with the 033 lowered suspension package.

The power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in Midnight Blue leather and complemented by a color-coordinated center console, door panels, and carpeting. Amenities include cruise control, air conditioning, and a Porsche Classic Communication Management head unit.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features Tiptronic S shift buttons and frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 300-km/h speedometer, an analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 26k kilometers (~16k miles).

The air-cooled 3.6L M64 flat-six features a VarioRam intake system and was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 250 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed automatic transaxle with Tiptronic S manual shift mode.

Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:

  • L3AS — Blue Turquoise paint
  • FJ — Midnight Blue partial leather upholstery
  • C08 — Version for Japan
  • 033 — Lowered suspension
  • 249 — Four-speed Tiptronic transaxle
  • 425 — Rear window wiper
  • 445 — Wheel caps with full-color Porsche crests
  • 567 — Top-tinted windscreen
  • 573 — Air conditioner
  • 659 — Onboard computer

The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage from an initial update in July 2023.

The Michigan title carries a “not eligible for plates” notation.

Filed under: 993
